titleStmt.title: The healing attempt being a representation of the government of the Church of England, according to the judgment of her bishops unto the end of Q. Elizabeths reign, humbly tendred to the consideration of the thirty commissionated for a consult about ecclesiastical affairs in order to a comprehension, and published in hopes of such a moderation of episcopacy, that the power be kept within the line of our first reformers, and the excercise of it reduced to the model of Arch-Bishop Usher.
titleStmt.author: Humfrey, John, 1621-1719.

titleStmt.title: The healing attempt being a representation of the government of the Church of England, according to the judgment of her bishops unto the end of Q. Elizabeths reign, humbly tendred to the consideration of the thirty commissionated for a consult about ecclesiastical affairs in order to a comprehension, and published in hopes of such a moderation of episcopacy, that the power be kept within the line of our first reformers, and the excercise of it reduced to the model of Arch-Bishop Usher.
titleStmt.author: Humfrey, John, 1621-1719.

notesStmt.note: Attributed to John Humfrey. Cf. NUC pre-1956.
Reproduction of original in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library.
